intro: Cyrtandra hyperdasa, commonly known as the Hawaiian beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, bright purple berries. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are small, white, and clustered in cymes, often blooming before the fruit develops.
